body.name: Behind The Baron's Mask: A Clean Regency Romance (Resolved In Love)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 16 hrs 47 mins
body.description: Miss Cecilia Richards wants to marry for true love. Henry Neil, Baron of Neil, wants to spend all his days writing. After sharing a romantic dance at a masquerade, will fate bring them back together?Cecilia is entering her third Season, refusing to give up the hope that her true love is still out there. Emboldened by her mask, Cecilia puts on a spectacular pianoforte performance at an illustrious masquerade. She is whisked away to the dance floor by the most incredible man she’s ever met—a fellow passionate artist. Unfortunately, he slips out of reach before she can learn his name. Instead, she must accompany the cold and aloof Lord Neil through London as his best friend courts her sister.Henry just wants to stay at home writing his beloved adventure novels. But when his best friend drags him to the annual welcome masquerade, Henry dances with an incredibly talented pianoforte player. She surprises him with her artistic insights, but they part without exchanging identities. And much to Henry’s dismay, his friend decides to court a beautiful young lady—and asks Henry to accompany them with her older sister, Miss Cecilia Richards.Can Cecilia and Henry learn that they have far more in common than they think? Will they realize that they could be each other’s missing pieces?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Cecilia has always wanted to hold out for true love, and she has, for three seasons now. This year, Cecilia's younger sister, Juliet is coming out. However, Cecilia's parents have had enough and are pushing her to marry. At a masked ball, Cecilia dances with a masked man she feels she could love. However, they don't exchange names and Cecilia begins to wonder if she will ever find him again.This was a charming Regency read, complete with events and clothes and I love the language used in this novel. I thoroughly enjoyed reading it and highly recommend it to others who enjoy sweet Regencies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
reviews.reviewText: The first book by Penny Fairbanks, a good read. I will try more by this lady.A bit of a long in places. A little wordy, but a good start.I wish her well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The First of a Winning Series
reviews.reviewText: Penny Fairbanks has created an intriguing series of entertaining characters in interesting situations. Behind the Baron’s Mask is a multilayered story with unique consequences. Cecilia is involved with three different men, a maskerader, an author, and a reclusive nobleman, who turn out to be the same person. I look forward to continuing the journey with the next in the series that features the lovely maid Violet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Clean enjoyable readread
reviews.reviewText: This story has a lot of potential and was nice and clean. I did feel it was a bit slow in the dialog at time. I felt I wanted to skip some of the extraneous info.My biggest frustration though and why I gave this only 3 stars is the premise used of the masquerade meeting of the H and h. I’ve read this before where the two don’t recognize each other later when they meet. This makes no sense, if the dance and conversation was so memorable that you fell in love with the person, how is it they couldn’t recognize the voice of each other! Plus they only wore a mask as well. So their hair was visible, heights Etc. So it just isn’t believable that there was absolutely no recognition until he said a similar phrase from the masquerade many months later. So that reduced the story by a star.Stories need to be realistic enough to be believable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the characters in this story very much. I am looking forward to reading another,r book in this series!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this sweet Regency tale of hidden identity which kept me pleasantly turning pages to see how the story would unfold. Cecilia and Lord Neil definitely had their similarities as well as some differences which made for an interesting and entertaining read. I look forward to reading the other books in the series!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2021
reviews.reviewText: This was an absolutely engaging story! This was my first book to read of Penny Fairbanks. I could definitely relate to Cecilia. I will definitely read the rest of the books in this series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Seeking love she dances smoothly and with delight a masked man. She’s a musician: he’s a writer. Melding their talents results in true love and a richer and fuller life together.

Cecilia is in her third Season and has still not found a suitable match. At a masquerade ball, Cecilia meets someone whom she thinks is all she ever wished for…The characters and their emotions are very well described. I could see myself in the ballroom, being equally as enraptured by Cecilia’s piano play as Henry. The romance was enthralling. The balance between hope, despair, mystery, and love was perfect. If I had something to criticize, it would be that we never learn why Juliet stopped seeing Solomon, she does not even give a hint to her sister. But I guess that this story will be told in a sequel, so I will be patient until then, being sure that the next book will be as enjoyable to read as this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 9, 2019
reviews.reviewText: Cecilia and Henry' story was very entertaining and enjoyable. Both had become enamoured by masked characters they'd met at a ball and didn't realise they were 'socialising' in an enforced manner due to Cecilia chaperoning her younger sister. The story was delightful and the main characters endearing, the sister and mother were the usual society climbers and of course the younger sister was thought to have more to offer than the older sister, but Cecilia captured her H.E.A eventually.I would thoroughly recommend this book and look forward to the next book in the series.

Excellent. Thoroughly enjoyed this book. I appreciated the extra effort you made to give the characters depth and understanding how the ton in regency times can't work for money but many have the ability.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 1, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: Good book: characters occasionally irritating, (wishy washy)
reviews.reviewText: I liked the book well enough, hence 4 stars, but I did occasionally find both characters a bit annoying, in that they were so helpless, and didn't get mad at each other or their problems, just distraught, until it finally all resolved.That being said, it did have teeth at moments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 8, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: Cecilia and Henry’s ups and downs to love.
reviews.reviewText: Cecilia and Henry’s love story ,at last someone tells him straight that his way of thinking was stupid and not to try to explain his reasons for breaking with her was insulting,oh men’s pride always gets in the way of future happiness thankfully not this time ,loved their story.
